summary: This bill, the "Medically Tailored Home-Delivered Meals Program Pilot Act," proposes a Medicare program to provide medically tailored home-delivered meals to certain individuals under Medicare Part A. It aims to improve clinical health outcomes and reduce hospital readmissions. The program would involve selected hospitals providing meals and medical nutrition therapy to qualified individuals meeting specific criteria, with data collection and evaluations to assess its effectiveness. The program would be funded from the Federal Hospital Insurance Trust Fund, with adjustments to ensure budget neutrality. The bill outlines eligibility requirements, program requirements, payment mechanisms, and reporting directives.
